question: Pressure of ideal gas at constant volume is proportional to
choices: Average kinetic energy of the molecules
Average potential energy of the molecules
explanation: Also, for ideal gas, <katex>$PV = nRT$</katex> and Energy <katex>$U = \frac{f}{2} nRT$</katex>. So <katex>$T \propto U$</katex>. Since <katex>$P \propto T$</katex> at constant V, <katex>$P \propto$</katex> Total Internal Energy.
The answer key A refers to 'Total energy'. Note: For ideal gas, total energy is purely kinetic.
